The Chapter with Sobhita
The Elder Pupphacchadani’s Birth Story
“The brahmin named Sunanda,
who had mastered the mantras,
a teacher who begged for a living,
performed a horse sacrifice.
Padumuttara, the knower of the world,
the chief, the compassionate sage,
out of compassion for the people,
was walking in the sky at that time.🔽Having walked in the sky,
the fully enlightened one, the all-knowing leader of the world,
pervaded beings with loving-kindness,

analyzed: ap pamāṇe nirūpadhi  vaṇṭe chetvāna pupphāni
translated: immeasurable, without attachment.🔽The brahmin who had mastered the mantras,
having cut the stalks of the flowers,
gathered all his disciples
and made them throw them into the sky.
As far as the city was,
the covering of flowers at that time;
by the Buddha’s power,
did not disappear for seven days.
By that very root of merit,
having experienced perfection,
having fully understood all the pollutants,
he crossed over the world’s entanglement.
In one hundred and one eons,
there were fifty-one nobles;
they were called Ambara,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical knowledges,🔽…

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pupphacchadaniyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā pupphacchadaniyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”🔽Thus has the Elder Pupphacchadaniya related these verses.
The Story of the Elder Pupphacchadaniya is finished.
